attributes.name: Park of the Seven Oars
attributes.description:
Near roundabout at Olympic Way, West Bay Dr and Harrison Ave NW

Pedestrian Access Only

0.90 Acres

Benches, Public Art, Viewpoint

Inspiration comes from an 1890's Bigelow family photograph of seven women in a row, oars at attention, on the shell scattered shores of Priest Point Park. The oars have historical significance for both the native people and early settlers of the area. The weaving patterns on the benches and walls were made by members of the Chehalis Tribe.

Artists: Seven Oars Partners: Tom Anderson, Karen Lohmann, Sarah Ogier, Mark Osborne, Joe Tougas
